listCustomWeapons.name: Leshy Lid
listCustomWeapons.description: You gain a lid unarmed attack that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage. Your lid is in the brawling group and has the agile, grapple, and unarmed traits.

listCustomWeapons.name: Serpentfolk Fangs
listCustomWeapons.description: You possess a sharp set of retractable fangs that can be used against foes. You have a fangs unarmed attack that deals 1d4 piercing damage. This unarmed attack is in the brawling group and has the finesse trait.

listCustomWeapons.name: Serpentfolk Tail Slap
listCustomWeapons.description: You gain a tail slap unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage. Your tail slap is in the brawling group and has the backswing and unarmed trails.

listCustomEquipment.name: Anti-Swarm Dust (greater)
listCustomEquipment.description:
In the Darklands, swarms are as terrifying as they are on the surface. Darklands alchemists have studied ways to keep these pests at bay and more easily control them without destroying them, since insects are a vital part of the environment. By studying fungi that repel certain types of insects, alchemists created a bomb to mimic their effects on insect swarms. Anti-swarm dust has no effect on non-insect swarms. On a successful hit, the target swarm must attempt a DC 28 Fortitude save.
Critical Success The swarm is unaffected.
Success The swarm is Stunned 1.
Failure The swarm is Fleeing for 1 round.
Critical Failure The swarm is Fleeing for 1 minute.

listCustomEquipment.name: Anti-Swarm Dust (lesser)
listCustomEquipment.description:
In the Darklands, swarms are as terrifying as they are on the surface. Darklands alchemists have studied ways to keep these pests at bay and more easily control them without destroying them, since insects are a vital part of the environment. By studying fungi that repel certain types of insects, alchemists created a bomb to mimic their effects on insect swarms. Anti-swarm dust has no effect on non-insect swarms. On a successful hit, the target swarm must attempt a DC 17 Fortitude save.
Critical Success The swarm is unaffected.
Success The swarm is Stunned 1.
Failure The swarm is Fleeing for 1 round.
Critical Failure The swarm is Fleeing for 1 minute.

listCustomEquipment.name: Anti-Swarm Dust (moderate)
listCustomEquipment.description:
In the Darklands, swarms are as terrifying as they are on the surface. Darklands alchemists have studied ways to keep these pests at bay and more easily control them without destroying them, since insects are a vital part of the environment. By studying fungi that repel certain types of insects, alchemists created a bomb to mimic their effects on insect swarms. Anti-swarm dust has no effect on non-insect swarms. On a successful hit, the target swarm must attempt a DC 20 Fortitude save.
Critical Success The swarm is unaffected.
Success The swarm is Stunned 1.
Failure The swarm is Fleeing for 1 round.
Critical Failure The swarm is Fleeing for 1 minute.

listCustomEquipment.name: Burrowing Grub
listCustomEquipment.description: This item take the form of a dried larva roughly the length of a human thumb. You activate the grub by eating it, though the effects vary based on how you consume it. If you swallow the grub whole, you gain a burrow Speed equal to your land Speed until the end of your turn. If you chew the grub, you gain a burrow Speed of 5 feet for 1 minute.

listCustomEquipment.name: Glow Gel
listCustomEquipment.description:
While most who make their home in the Darklands have some ability to see in darkness, there are time when light is needed. While sunrods are not unheard of, many residents prefer a less brilliant form of light. Glow gel provides enough light to read by and to see where one is going. It is created by harvesting and preparing phosphorescent lichens in suspension where a solution containing the lichens is separated from a reagent by a thin layer of wax within a vial.
To activate glow gel, a creature shakes the vial vigorously, breaking the wax and mixing thee lichens and reagents. The resulting solution sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius for 6 hours. Optionally, once mixed, the solution can be applied to a surface but this exposure to air reduces the duration to 3 hours.

listCustomEquipment.name: Mind Cloud (greater)
listCustomEquipment.traits: Uncommon, Alchemical, Bomb, Consumable, Poison, 3rd Party
listCustomEquipment.description: Some fungi have hallucinogenic or mind-clouding properties when ingested. Darklands alchemists learned how to weaponize these properties. An alchemist often uses these bombs to soften up targets for subsequent mind-affecting spells. These bombs release an intoxicating cloud when they explode. Each creature in a 10-foot burst must attempt a DC 28 Fortitude save or take a -3 circumstance penalty on Will saves for 3 rounds.

listCustomEquipment.name: Mind Cloud (lesser)
listCustomEquipment.traits: Uncommon, Alchemical, Bomb, Consumable, Poison, 3rd Party
listCustomEquipment.description: Some fungi have hallucinogenic or mind-clouding properties when ingested. Darklands alchemists learned how to weaponize these properties. An alchemist often uses these bombs to soften up targets for subsequent mind-affecting spells. These bombs release an intoxicating cloud when they explode. Each creature in a 10-foot burst must attempt a DC 17 Fortitude save or take a -1 circumstance penalty on Will saves for 3 rounds.

listCustomEquipment.name: Mind Cloud (moderate)
listCustomEquipment.traits: Uncommon, Alchemical, Bomb, Consumable, Poison, 3rd Party
listCustomEquipment.description: Some fungi have hallucinogenic or mind-clouding properties when ingested. Darklands alchemists learned how to weaponize these properties. An alchemist often uses these bombs to soften up targets for subsequent mind-affecting spells. These bombs release an intoxicating cloud when they explode. Each creature in a 10-foot burst must attempt a DC 20 Fortitude save or take a -2 circumstance penalty on Will saves for 3 rounds.

listCustomEquipment.name: Mushroom Juice (greater)
listCustomEquipment.traits: Uncommon, Alchemical, Consumable, Elixir, Healing, 3rd Party
listCustomEquipment.description: The Darklands are host to a number of creatures and aberration the carry horrible diseases. By carefully distilling deadly toxic mushrooms, deep gnomes create a special intoxicant that can aid in fighting of disease. Due to the potent nature of this brew, it cannot be taken preventatively but instead must be taken within the onset period of the disease. Additionally, due to the toxic nature of the mushroom from which it is brewed, it inflicts 3d6 poison damage (subject to a basic DC 29 Fortitude save). You gain a +4 item bonus to all saves vs. a single disease afflicting you.

listCustomEquipment.name: Mushroom Juice (lesser)
listCustomEquipment.traits: Uncommon, Alchemical, Consumable, Elixir, Healing, 3rd Party
listCustomEquipment.description: The Darklands are host to a number of creatures and aberration the carry horrible diseases. By carefully distilling deadly toxic mushrooms, deep gnomes create a special intoxicant that can aid in fighting of disease. Due to the potent nature of this brew, it cannot be taken preventatively but instead must be taken within the onset period of the disease. Additionally, due to the toxic nature of the mushroom from which it is brewed, it inflicts 1d6 poison damage (subject to a basic DC 17 Fortitude save). You gain a +2 item bonus to all saves vs. a single disease afflicting you.

listCustomEquipment.name: Mushroom Juice (moderate)
listCustomEquipment.traits: Uncommon, Alchemical, Consumable, Elixir, Healing, 3rd Party
listCustomEquipment.description: The Darklands are host to a number of creatures and aberration the carry horrible diseases. By carefully distilling deadly toxic mushrooms, deep gnomes create a special intoxicant that can aid in fighting of disease. Due to the potent nature of this brew, it cannot be taken preventatively but instead must be taken within the onset period of the disease. Additionally, due to the toxic nature of the mushroom from which it is brewed, it inflicts 2d6 poison damage (subject to a basic DC 22 Fortitude save). You gain a +3 item bonus to all saves vs. a single disease afflicting you.

listCustomEquipment.name: Visitor's Gift
listCustomEquipment.description:
This item appears as an ordinary paper-wrapped confection. When you activate the gift, you use Glad-Hand (Player Core). As part of activating the gift, you must offer it to the target of your Diplomacy check, and the magic is used up whether or not they take or consume the treat.
If you have the Glad-Hand feat, you do not take the -5 penalty on your initial Diplomacy check.

listCustomFeats.name: Blighted
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites plant trait, you are from the Black Desert

Your leaves are nearly black. You are immune to blightburn sickness (Pathfinder Treasure Vault) and exposure to blightburn crystals counts as nourishment for the purposes of avoiding starvation. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on saving throws against disease.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Cave Runner
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Chthonic Skirmisher Dedication; trained in Acrobatics or Athletics
The inclines and slick cavern walls of the Darklands don't slow you down. Whenever you succeed at an Athletics check to Climb a cavern wall or an Acrobatics check to Balance a narrow ledge, you get a crucial success instead. Try aren't Off-Guard while Climbing or Balancing on cavern walls or narrow ledges.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Cavern Crunch
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Chthonic Skirmisher Dedication
The Darklands itself is your weapon. Make a Strike with a melee weapon. If you hit a target that is your size or smaller, you can automatically Shove it, with the same benefits as the Shove action (including the critical success effect, if your Strike was a critical hit). If you move to follow the target, your movement doesn't trigger reactions. If the creature you Shove has to stop moving because it would hit an object, it takes damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 1).
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Chip the Scales
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Spined Scales
Requirements You are unarmored or wearing light armor.

Your hardened scales can defend as well as damage. You deflect an attack onto your scales, preventing you from taking an amount of damage equal to three times your level. You take any remaining damage from this attack, and cannot use your Thorns reaction or Chip the Scales reaction until your scales are mended. If you benefit from a successful Treat Wounds, your scales are mended in addition to your healing, allowing you to use both this reaction and Thorns as normal.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Chthonic Skirmisher Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You specialize in fighting in the untamable tunnnels of the Darklands. You become trained in Survival and Darklands Lore, or if you were already trained you become an expert. When in underground terrain, you can ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain.

Additional Feats
4th Snagging Strike (Player Core), 6th Barreling Charge (Player Core), Quick Reversal (Player Core), 8th Skirmish Strike (Player Core), Snap Shot (Player Core), 10th Hazard Finder (Player Core), 12th Warden's Step (Player Core), 16th Sense the Unseen (Player Core)
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Coiled Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites fangs unarmed attack

You can patiently wait for an opportunity to lash out. You gain the Reactive Strike Reaction until the beginning of your next turn, but can only Strike with your fangs. If you already possess Reactive Strike, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus on this attack roll.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Constant Coiling
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Coiled Strike

You constantly remain ready to strike with your fangs at the unwary. You can use Coiled Strike as a free action.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Cramped Maneuver
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Chthonic Skirmisher Dedication
You are used to fighting in close quarters with little room to move, and you know tricks to accommodate your allies. Until the start of your next turn you do not provide enemies with lesser cover from your allies' attacks, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on Relex saves against your own spells, as well as those of your allies.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Darklands Survivor
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Chthonic Skirmisher Dedication
You know the Darklands well, as well as the many dangers is conceals. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against environmental hazards occurring in underground regions. If you roll a success on a saving throw against such an effect, you get a critical success instead. This does not apply to unnatural events created or directed by active effects, such as spells that creature anomalous weather or hazardous areas.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Dash Upon the Rocks
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Chthonic Skirmisher Dedication, Cavern Crunch
There are grim benefit to fighting while surrounded by solid earth. When you use Cavern Crunch, you can also Stride once to reach your target before you Strike. Additionally, if the target creature would take damage because they could not move when Shoved, your Strike deals one additional weapon damage die.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Echoing Aggression
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Chthonic Skirmisher Dedication; trained in Intimidation
You know that the acoustics of encloses spaces can be a weapon all their own, so you shout, bash an object against the wall, or make a loud noise. When you Demoralize a target in an enclosed space, like a cavern, tunnel, or inside a building, you don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language, and the range of Demoralize increases to 60 feet.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Emotive Mastery
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your mind is heavily locked against manipulation of your newfound feelings. When you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical success instead. If your heritage is steelthought serpentfolk, when you roll a critical failure against an emotion effect you get a failure instead.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Epiphyte
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites fungus trait
Strands of fungal fibers allow you to cling to plants and rocks. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Fleshfolk Skin-Veil
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You have a rudimentary understanding of your people's ability to change their appearance at will, and cloak yourself in illusion to blend in with other ancestries. This functions as a 3rd-level illusory disguise spell, with the following adjustments. Your illusion always disguises you in the same way each time; this form is of a specific member of a common ancestry. This ability is not a spell, and cannot be dispelled as one. You can change your disguise to that of another ancestry or another individual of your current ancestry by spending 1 week of downtime in observation and magical study; you can still use your original disguise during this time.
listCustomFeats.traits: Auditory, Concentrate, Illusion, Occult, Olfactory, Serpentfolk, Visual, Zyss, 3rd Party
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Inhabit Corpse
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites fungus trait
You can temporarily revitalize a corpse by infusing it with a network of mycelium from your own body. Once per day, you can cast talking corpse as a primal innate spell.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Lid Slam
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites pitcher plant leshy heritage
You gain a lid unarmed attack that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage. Your lid is in the brawling group and has the agile, grapple, and unarmed traits.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Mutable Features
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your physiology is responsive to your wishes, allowing you to change your shape in subtle ways. When you make your daily preparations, you gain one serpentfolk feat of 9th level or lower that you don't already have. You can use that feat until your next daily preparations. You must meet all of that feat's other requirements.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Mycelium Form
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites fungus trait
You can turn into strands of mycelium. Once per day, you can cast one with stone as a primal innate spell, except you merge with soil (or other soft earth) or dead organic material (such as wood or a corpse) instead of stone. You can cause a patch of mushrooms to sprout from the surface you merged with, allowing you to see outside of the material.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Pitcher Swallow
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Lid Slam
You gain the Swallow Whole ability (Monster Core pg. 360). You can attempt to swallow a Tiny creature that is grappled by your lid (or a creature up to one size category smaller than you if you increase in size). The swallowed creature takes acid damage equal to your lid damage when first swallowed and at the end of each of its turns while it's swallowed. You have a Rupture value equal to 20% of your maximum hitpoints.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Roots of the Earth
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites root leshy heritage or Anchoring Roots

Your roots are especially sensitive to movement around you. You gain tremorsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Sekmin Telepathy
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You gain telepathy out to a range of 30 feet, as the creature ability; you can only communicate in this way with creatures with whom you share a language. You can only send messages to others, not receive them, and conversing telepathically with multiple creatures simultaneously is just as difficult as listening to multiple people speak (though you can send the same message to multiple creatures).
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Serpentfolk Lore
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
The traditions of the sekmin, whether aapoph or zyss, have been kept for centuries, regardless of how much you follow their sinister aims. If you are a zyss, you become trained in Deception and Occultism. If you are an aapoph, you become trained in Athletics and Diplomacy. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.
You also gain the Additional Lore skill feat for Serpenfolk Lore.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Serpentfolk Lore
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
The traditions of the sekmin, whether aapoph or zyss, have been kept for centuries, regardless of how much you follow their sinister aims. If you are a zyss, you become trained in Deception and Occultism. If you are an aapoph, you become trained in Athletics and Diplomacy. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.
You also gain the Additional Lore skill feat for Serpenfolk Lore.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Serpentfolk Venom
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency a number of times per day equal to your level

You envenom your fangs. If the next fangs Strike you make before the end of your turn hits and deals damage, the Strike deals an additional 1d6 poison damage. On a critical failure, the poison is wasted as normal. At 12th level, this poison damage increases to 2d6.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Share Sap
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Viscous Sap

You can quickly harden your sap to sculpt an object of negligible Bulk. You can instead make an item of light Bulk, but you cannot use this ability again for 1 day. These items have a rubbery consistency, have no resale value, and they naturally degrade over 24 hours without regular (if minor) maintenance. You can maintain up to 10 such items at a time.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Snake Familiar
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Mundane snakes are common companions to serpentfolk. You gain a familiar, and that familiar must be a snake. It still gets the benefits of familiar abilities, but its base form remains a snake. However, you can change this familiar to a seru (see page 13 of The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands) if you meet the prerequisites.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Spined Scales
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Requirements You are unarmored or wearing light armor.

Your scales are so sharp and rigid that they can retaliate against unwary foes. You are always treated as wearing twining chains, without the equipment's penalties.the damage dealt to both you and your target from your Thorns reaction increase with your proficiency with unarmed attacks; the damage increases to 2d6 if you are an expert with unarmed attacks, 3d6 if you are a master, and 4d6 if you are legendary.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Suggestive Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You retain the mind-bending magic your kin are feared for. You can cast suggestion as a 4th-rank occult innate spell once per day.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Telepathic Sense
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sekmin Telepathy

You can sense nearby minds far more clearly than most expect. You gain thoughtsense as an imprecise since within range of your telepathy. Your thoughtsense detects only thinking creatures, so a creature that is unthinking or otherwise immune to mental effects (such as many constructs and oozes) can't be perceived using your thoughtsense, regardless of how precise it is. Additionally, increase the range of your telepathy by 20 feet.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Viscous Sap
listCustomFeats.textDescription: The fluids in your body are thick like sap or tar. Your DC on flat checks to end persistent bleed damage its reduced from 15 to 10, or from 10 to 5 after receiving especially appropriate assistance.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Wordless Telepathy
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sekmin Telepathy

Your mental communication transcends words. You no longer need two share a language with a creature to communicate with them telepathically. Additionally, increase the range of your telepathy by 20 feet.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFeats.name: Zyss Spell Familiarity
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You develop more of your ancestral beguiling magic. During your daily preparations, choose illusory disguise, runic body, or ventriloquism. You can cast this as a 1st-rank occult innate spell once per day.
listCustomFeats.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Bioluminescent Leshy
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Your body is made from fungus that naturally glows with green light. You shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light to the next 20 feet. You can suppress or resume this ability as an action with the concentrate trait. You lose the plant trait and gain the fungus trait.
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Coil Disguise Serpentfolk
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: You delve deeper into the zyss magic of obscuring your appearance than most of your peers. You gain Fleshfolk Skin-Veil as a bonus feat. When you are using your disguised form, you can use your Occultism modifier in place of Deception when Impersonating a member of that ancestry and to Lie about your identity. This heritage gives you the zyss trait.
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Envenomed Serpentfolk (Aapoph)
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: The poison in your veins runs through your fangs as well. You gain the Serpentfolk Venom ability. This heritage gives you either the aapoph or zyss trait (you choose).
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Envenomed Serpentfolk (Zyss)
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: The poison in your veins runs through your fangs as well. You gain the Serpentfolk Venom ability. This heritage gives you either the aapoph or zyss trait (you choose).
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Pitcher Plant Leshy
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: The leaves of your body form a lidded hollow with nectar inside. The nectar may smell like sweet syrup or rotten meat. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on Nature checks to Command an Animal that can smell your nectar. If you have Wild Empathy, this bonus is also applied to Diplomacy checks on animals that can smell your nectar. If you consume fresh meat, you can go without sunlight for 2 weeks before you begin to starve.
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Poisonblood Serpentfolk (Aapoph)
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Poison runs in your veins, giving you capable defenses against its use. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a poison affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison. This heritage gives you either the aapoph or zyss trait (you choose).
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Poisonblood Serpentfolk (Zyss)
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Poison runs in your veins, giving you capable defenses against its use. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a poison affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison. This heritage gives you either the aapoph or zyss trait (you choose).
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Steelthought Serpentfolk (Aapoph)
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: You're learning to master the nascent emotion that you now experience. When you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical success instead. This heritage gives you either the aapoph or zyss trait (you choose).
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Steelthought Serpentfolk (Zyss)
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: You're learning to master the nascent emotion that you now experience. When you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical success instead. This heritage gives you either the aapoph or zyss trait (you choose).
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomHeritages.name: Thicktail Serpentfolk
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Aapoph physiology lends itself to having thicker scales, which makes your tail dense enough to use in combat. You gain a tail slap unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage. Your tail slap is in the unarmed group and has the backswing and unarmed traits. This heritage gives you the aapoph trait.
listCustomHeritages.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomSpecial.name: Aapoph Serpentfolk
listCustomSpecial.description:
You are an Aapoph Serpentfolk. Your ability boosts are in Strength and Wisdom, and you have a flaw in Intelligence.

The ability boosts and flaws are automatically applied to your sheet. When choosing your free ability boost, Pathbuilder will still allow you to choose Strength and Wisdom. However, you may only choose from Constitution, Dexterity, Charisma, or Intelligence.
listCustomSpecial.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomSpecial.name: Zyss Serpentfolk
listCustomSpecial.description:
You are a Zyss Serpentfolk. Your ability boost is in Intelligence.

The ability boost is automatically applied to your sheet. When choosing your free ability boost, Pathbuilder will still allow you to choose Intelligence. However, you may only choose from Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Charisma, or Wisdom.
listCustomSpecial.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomAncestries.name: Serpentfolk
listCustomAncestries.description: Serpentfolk are heirs to a forgotten legacy, long since toppled by humanity. Though serpentfolk have plotted their vengeance for eons beyond reckoning, a few heretical voices now offer an alternative to cruelty and dominance—what if, they suggest, empathy and humility and cooperation were to be tried? After all, it could hardly be less successful…
listCustomAncestries.languages: Aklo, Common or Sakvroth. Additional languages equal to your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from Common, Dwarven, Elven, Gnomish, Sakvroth, and any other language to which you have access.
listCustomAncestries.special:
Ancestral Variance
Your heritage determines whether you gain the aapoph or zyss trait. If a serpentfolk trait possesses either of these traits, you can only select it if you possess the corresponding trait. (The ability boosts granted to each variant are applied automatically when gaining the trait within Pathbuilder.)

Darkvision
You can see in darkness and dim light just as well as you can see in bright light, though your vision in darkness is in black and white.

Fangs
You possess a sharp set of retractable fangs that can be used against foes. You have a fangs unarmed attack that deals 1d4 piercing damage. This unarmed attack is in the brawling group and has the finesse trait.
listCustomAncestries.src: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomFamiliars.name: Seru
listCustomFamiliars.description: Serus have long shared a relationship with serpentfolk, with some mythology even describing them as creations of Ydersius to aid in their war against humanity. Though they are intelligent enough to form their own societies, an increasing number of serus have joined serpentfolk as familiars. This close association has spread cruelty to some seru enclaves, though not all have been infected with malice. Some more curious serus have accompanied emotive serpentfolk on their journeys to explore a kinder life, and have found themselves as entranced by their new surroundings as their companions. This has led to a rise in surface-dwelling pockets of serus. Serus resemble juvenile cobras with thin, leathery wings. Their scales can take on a variety of patterns, with ranges rivaling serpentfolk. Serus can grow to Small size by the end of their natural lifespan, though those who become familiars remain Tiny while bonded to their masters, regardless of age.
listCustomFamiliars.source: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomSpecials.name: Natural Liar
listCustomSpecials.description: Your seru familiar's familiarity with deceit is a great boon to you. Your seru familiar has the partner in crime (Player Core) familiar ability, but can only Aid you on Deception checks.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spit Venom
listCustomSpecials.description: Frequency once per hour Your seru familiar makes a ranged attack against a creature within 30 feet. This action‘s attack roll modifier is equal to your spell attack roll modifier or your class DC–10, whichever is higher. If the Strike is successful, the target takes 1d6 poison damage for every 3 levels you possess and is blinded for 1d4 rounds; on a critical success, the damage is doubled and the duration is 1 minute.

listCustomFamiliars.name: Typhilipede
listCustomFamiliars.description: Typhilipedes are natives of Hell, though not devils. They are purportedly descended from gnats that came to be trapped in Erebus after hitching a ride on an endless candle, the tragic result of an infernal bargain. They occasionally slip through planar rifts to The Universe, but are regarded as pests across the multiverse. Their preferred diet is light, as they metabolize the energy gained from its extinguishing. Hryngar hold these creatures in high regard as pets and familiars, due to their shared affinities for Hell and the dark. Particularly well-fed specimens are symbols of affluence. Typhilipedes possess night-black, segmented bodies with dozens of scraping, skittering legs. Two pairs of insectile wings sprout from between body segments closer to the creature's head, which bears two pairs of eyes and oversized mandibles glistening with sickly ichor.
listCustomFamiliars.source: The Traveler's Guide to the Darklands

listCustomSpecials.name: Aura of Shadow
listCustomSpecials.description: Frequency once per 10 minutes Range 10 feet Duration 3 rounds Your typhilipede familiar creates a region of shadowy darkness. All creatures witthin the area become Concealed, and all creatures outside the area become Concealed to creatures within it, unless the creature has low-light vision or darkvision. Your typhilipede familiar can end this effect early with a single action that has the concentrate trait.

listCustomSpecials.name: Hell's Sight
listCustomSpecials.description: Your typhilipede familiar is used to seeing in the worst of conditions, but in few others. They have both greater darkvision and Light Blindness.

listCustomSpecials.name: Lumivore
listCustomSpecials.description: Frequency once per hour Area 15-foot emanation Your typhilipede familiar consumes light through a process of energy absorption. All mundane light sources within range are immediately extinguished; they do not produce smoke or other normal effects of being snuffed out. For each light source it consumes this way, your typhilipede familiar gains 1 temporary Hit Point (maximum 10) that last for 1 hour.
